CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Under 1.5 G^100 mW cm^-2 illumination , a best PCE of 3.12% for PDTP-DT2BT was recorded , with V OC = 0.48 V , J SC = 11.43 mA cm^-2 , and FF = 0.57.

Let's think step by step.

1.5 G^1 (Gigahertz squared)
1.5 G^100 (Gigahertz squared, hundredth power)
mW (milliwatt)
cm^-2 (square centimeter)
PDTP-DT2BT (Material Name)
PCE (Percentage of Charge Extraction)
VOC (Open Circuit Voltage)
V (Volt)
J SC (Short Circuit Current Density)
mA (milliampere)
cm^-2 (square centimeter)
FF (Fill Factor)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Under 1.5 G^100 mW cm^-2 illumination , a best PCE of 3.12% for PDTP-DT2BT was recorded , with V OC = 0.48 V , J SC = 11.43 mA cm^-2 , and FF = 0.57.

Let's think step by step.

1.5 G^1 (Gigawatts per square centimeter) - Illumination power density
PCE (Percentage of conversion efficiency) - 3.12%
PDTP-DT2BT (Name of the photovoltaic device)
Voc (Open circuit voltage) - 0.48 Volts
Jsc (Short circuit current density) - 11.43 mA cm^-2 (milliamperes per square centimeter)
FF (Fill factor) - 0.57.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1.5 G^1 (Gigawatts per square centimeter) - Illumination power density
PDTP-DT2BT (Name of the photovoltaic material or device)
PCE (Percentage of conversion efficiency) - Material property
Voc (Open circuit voltage) - Material property
Jsc (Short circuit current density) - Material property.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| 1.5 G^1 (Gigawatts per square centimeter) - Illumination power density |
| PDTP-DT2BT (Name of the photovoltaic material or device) |
| Percentage of conversion efficiency (PCE) |
| Open circuit voltage (Voc) |
| Short circuit current density (Jsc) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Under 1.5 G^100 mW cm^-2 illumination , a best PCE of 3.12% for PDTP-DT2BT was recorded , with V OC = 0.48 V , J SC = 11.43 mA cm^-2 , and FF = 0.57.

Let's think step by step.

1.5 G^100 mW cm^-2 (Power density)
3.12% (Best PCE or Power Conversion Efficiency)
0.48 V (Open Circuit Voltage or Voc)
11.43 mA cm^-2 (Short Circuit Current Density or Jsc)
0.57 (Fill Factor or FF)

These are the "Property Value" entities mentioned in the paragraph. They represent specific numerical values related to the performance of a photovoltaic device (PDTP-DT2BT) under certain illumination conditions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

3.12% (Power Conversion Efficiency or PCE)
0.48 V (Open Circuit Voltage or Voc)
11.43 mA cm^-2 (Short Circuit Current Density or Jsc)

These are the entities that clearly refer to the values of material properties in the paragraph. They describe the electrical performance of the photovoltaic material (PDTP-DT2BT) under specific illumination conditions. The other entities, such as "1.5 G^100 mW cm^-2" and "illumination," are not material properties but rather the conditions under which the measurements were taken.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 3.12% |
| 0.48 V |
| 11.43 mA cm^-2 |

These are the entities presented as a Markdown table with a single column named "Property Value." The values represent the precise descriptions of the material properties mentioned in the original paragraph.
